p: Table 2 and Figure 2 presents the results of in vitro anti‐ T. gondii activity and selectivity. The essential oil exhibited the highest toxicity against T. gondii tachyzoites at 1,000 μg (Figure 2). The in vitro cytotoxicity assay indicated that the essential oil compounds had toxicity on the growth of T. gondii tachyzoites at concentrations as lower than 9.94 ± 0.38μg with a selectivity index (SI) of 2.463. Cytotoxicity (CC50, μg) (Vero + essential oil) produced better activity against the cell line. The essential oil was active against T. gondii tachyzoites with an IC50 value below 10 µg (Table 2).
